page.title: 01Changing Times
page.content: { Maghull,Changing Times. } Maghull was first mentioned in the Domesday Book as Magele.It was two leagues long and was one of 6 manors held by a Saxon, Uhtred. In medieval times it was probably a group of scattered farms with only the church as a nucleus. Today Maghull still has agricultural activity but much of the area is covered by housing estates and their amenities. It must be pointed out though that Maghull is not just a new town absorbing an overflow of people from Liverpool but also a rapidly growing village with roots far back in history. In the last 20 years the population has doubled to around 40,000.
